017package org.apache.juneau.rest.stats;
018
019import static java.util.Comparator.*;
020import static java.util.stream.Collectors.*;
021import static java.util.stream.Collectors.toList;
022import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
023
024import java.util.*;
025import java.util.concurrent.*;
026
027import org.apache.juneau.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
031
032/**
033 * An in-memory cache of thrown exceptions.
034 *
035 * <p>
036 * Used for preventing duplication of stack traces in log files and replacing them with small hashes.
037 *
038 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
039 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/ExecutionStatistics">REST method execution statistics</a>
040 * </ul>
041 */
042public class ThrownStore {
043
044   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
045   // Static
046   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
047
048   /** Identifies a single global store for the entire JVM. */
049   public static final ThrownStore GLOBAL = new ThrownStore();
050
051   /**
052    * Static creator.
053    *
054    * @param beanStore The bean store to use for creating beans.
055    * @return A new builder for this object.
056    */
057   public static Builder create(BeanStore beanStore) {
058      return new Builder(beanStore);
059   }
060
061   /**
062    * Static creator.
063    *
064    * @return A new builder for this object.
065    */
066   public static Builder create() {
067      return new Builder(BeanStore.INSTANCE);
068   }
069
070   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
071   // Builder
072   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
073
074   /**
075    * Builder class.
076    */
077   @FluentSetters
078   public static class Builder extends BeanBuilder<ThrownStore> {
079
080      ThrownStore parent;
081      Class<? extends ThrownStats> statsImplClass;
082      Set<Class<?>> ignoreClasses;
083
084      /**
085       * Constructor.
086       *
087       * @param beanStore The bean store to use for creating beans.
088       */
089      protected Builder(BeanStore beanStore) {
090         super(ThrownStore.class, beanStore);
091      }
092
093      @Override /* BeanBuilder */
094      protected ThrownStore buildDefault() {
095         return new ThrownStore(this);
096      }
097
098      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
099      // Properties
100      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
101
102      /**
103       * Specifies a subclass of {@link ThrownStats} to use for individual method statistics.
104       *
105       * @param value The new value for this setting.
106       * @return This object.
107       */
108      public Builder statsImplClass(Class<? extends ThrownStats> value) {
109         this.statsImplClass = value;
110         return this;
111      }
112
113      /**
114       * Specifies the parent store of this store.
115       *
116       * <p>
117       * Parent stores are used for aggregating statistics across multiple child stores.
118       * <br>The {@link ThrownStore#GLOBAL} store can be used for aggregating all thrown exceptions in a single JVM.
119       *
120       * @param value The parent store.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
121       * @return This object.
122       */
123      public Builder parent(ThrownStore value) {
124         this.parent = value;
125         return this;
126      }
127
128      /**
129       * Specifies the list of classes to ignore when calculating stack traces.
130       *
131       * <p>
132       * Stack trace elements that are the specified class will be ignored.
133       *
134       * @param value The list of classes to ignore.
135       * @return This object.
136       */
137      public Builder ignoreClasses(Class<?>...value) {
138         this.ignoreClasses = Utils.set(value);
139         return this;
140      }
141
142      // <FluentSetters>
143
144      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanBuilder */
145      public Builder impl(Object value) {
146         super.impl(value);
147         return this;
148      }
149
150      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanBuilder */
151      public Builder type(Class<?> value) {
152         super.type(value);
153         return this;
154      }
155
156      // </FluentSetters>
157   }
158
159   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
160   // Instance
161   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
162
163   private final ConcurrentHashMap<Long,ThrownStats> db = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
164   private final Optional<ThrownStore> parent;
165   private final BeanStore beanStore;
166   private final Class<? extends ThrownStats> statsImplClass;
167   private final Set<String> ignoreClasses;
168
169   /**
170    * Constructor.
171    */
172   public ThrownStore() {
173      this(create(BeanStore.INSTANCE));
174   }
175
176   /**
177    * Constructor.
178    *
179    * @param builder The builder for this object.
180    */
181   public ThrownStore(Builder builder) {
182      this.parent = Utils.opt(builder.parent);
183      this.beanStore = builder.beanStore();
184
185      this.statsImplClass = Utils.firstNonNull(builder.statsImplClass, parent.isPresent() ? parent.get().statsImplClass : null, null);
186
187      Set<String> s = null;
188      if (builder.ignoreClasses != null)
189         s = builder.ignoreClasses.stream().map(Class::getName).collect(toSet());
190      if (s == null && parent.isPresent())
191         s = parent.get().ignoreClasses;
192      if (s == null)
193         s = Collections.emptySet();
194      this.ignoreClasses = u(s);
195   }
196
197
198   /**
199    * Adds the specified thrown exception to this database.
200    *
201    * @param e The exception to add.
202    * @return This object.
203    */
204   public ThrownStats add(Throwable e) {
205      ThrownStats s = find(e);
206      s.increment();
207      parent.ifPresent(x->x.add(e));
208      return s;
209   }
210
211   /**
212    * Retrieves the stats for the specified thrown exception.
213    *
214    * @param e The exception.
215    * @return A clone of the stats, never <jk>null</jk>.
216    */
217   public Optional<ThrownStats> getStats(Throwable e) {
218      return getStats(hash(e));
219   }
220
221   /**
222    * Retrieves the stack trace information for the exception with the specified hash as calculated by {@link #hash(Throwable)}.
223    *
224    * @param hash The hash of the exception.
225    * @return A clone of the stack trace info, never <jk>null</jk>.
226    */
227   public Optional<ThrownStats> getStats(long hash) {
228      ThrownStats s = db.get(hash);
229      return Utils.opt(s == null ? null : s.clone());
230   }
231
232   /**
233    * Returns the list of all stack traces in this database.
234    *
235    * @return The list of all stack traces in this database, cloned and sorted by count descending.
236    */
237   public List<ThrownStats> getStats() {
238      return db.values().stream().map(ThrownStats::clone).sorted(comparingInt(ThrownStats::getCount).reversed()).collect(toList());
239   }
240
241   /**
242    * Clears out the stack trace cache.
243    */
244   public void reset() {
245      db.clear();
246   }
247
248   /**
249    * Calculates a 32-bit hash for the specified throwable based on the stack trace generated by {@link #createStackTrace(Throwable)}.
250    *
251    * <p>
252    * Subclasses can override this method to provide their own implementation.
253    *
254    * @param t The throwable to calculate the stack trace on.
255    * @return A calculated hash.
256    */
257   protected long hash(Throwable t) {
258      long h = 1125899906842597L; // prime
259      for (String s : createStackTrace(t)) {
260         int len = s.length();
261         for (int i = 0; i < len; i++)
262            h = 31*h + s.charAt(i);
263      }
264      return h;
265   }
266
267   /**
268    * Converts the stack trace for the specified throwable into a simple list of strings.
269    *
270    * <p>
271    * The stack trace elements for the throwable are sent through {@link #normalize(StackTraceElement)} to convert
272    * them to simple strings.
273    *
274    *
275    * @param t The throwable to create the stack trace for.
276    * @return A modifiable list of strings.
277    */
278   protected List<String> createStackTrace(Throwable t) {
279      return alist(t.getStackTrace()).stream().filter(this::include).map(this::normalize).collect(toList());
280   }
281
282   /**
283    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified stack trace element should be included in {@link #createStackTrace(Throwable)}.
284    *
285    * @param e The stack trace element.
286    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified stack trace element should be included in {@link #createStackTrace(Throwable)}.
287    */
288   protected boolean include(StackTraceElement e) {
289      return true;
290   }
291
292   /**
293    * Converts the specified stack trace element into a normalized string.
294    *
295    * <p>
296    * The default implementation simply replaces <js>"\\$.*"</js> with <js>"..."</js> which should take care of stuff like stack
297    * trace elements of lambda expressions.
298    *
299    * @param e The stack trace element to convert.
300    * @return The converted stack trace element.
301    */
302   protected String normalize(StackTraceElement e) {
303      if (ignoreClasses.contains(e.getClassName()))
304         return "<ignored>";
305      String s = e.toString();
306      int i = s.indexOf('$');
307      if (i == -1)
308         return s;
309      int j = s.indexOf('(', i);
310      if (j == -1)
311         return s;  // Probably can't happen.
312      String s2 = s.substring(0, i), s3 = s.substring(j);
313      if (ignoreClasses.contains(s2))
314         return "<ignored>";
315      return s2 + "..." + s3;
316   }
317
318   private ThrownStats find(final Throwable t) {
319
320      if (t == null)
321         return null;
322
323      long hash = hash(t);
324
325      ThrownStats stc = db.get(hash);
326      if (stc == null) {
327         stc = ThrownStats
328            .create(beanStore)
329            .type(statsImplClass)
330            .throwable(t)
331            .hash(hash)
332            .stackTrace(createStackTrace(t))
333            .causedBy(find(t.getCause()))
334            .build();
335
336         db.putIfAbsent(hash, stc);
337         stc = db.get(hash);
338      }
339
340      return stc;
341   }
342}
